metadata.Title: CVE-2015-2754 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
FreeXL before 1.0.0i allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (stack corruption) and possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted workbook, related to a "premature EOF."

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-2754` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libfreexl1 - 1.0.0h-1~exp1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: freexl package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.0h-1~exp1ubuntu1').
